intro: Hymenonema tournefortii, commonly known as the Cape fynbos, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and dense foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained, sandy soils. It is well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region, with a dormant period during the wet season. Hymenonema tournefortii plays an important role in local ecosystems and is valued for its ornamental and ecological significance.
